channel.title: Audiosurf
channel.description:
So, I'm sure many of play Audiosurf (if you don't, go die in a hole), and if you do, I'm sure you saw the new updates to the game and the Site.
[url]https://www.audio-surf.com[/url]
Now you can manage your friends, view the songs you are champion of and what your friends are champions of.
I've been addicted to Audiosurf the day it came out and love to find more ways to make it a group game (at the next LAN event in Brisbane, I'm organising an Audiosurf Knockout Tournament).
So what I propose to all audiosurfers (partially stealing Cpl.Insane's idea) is that we start a league within BM, each week on a chose day, we race 1 or 2 songs, and use the points we got and add it to our overall score, the league will go for either a month or 2 so winners can be announced often.
So if you wish to sign up, post here, and depending on how many people, I'll decide on a way to choose each weeks song fairly.
Also post your Audiosurf page if you want :3
[url]https://www.audio-surf.com/mypage.php?u=Collision[/url]

item.title: Audiosurf
item.dc:creator: Collision
item.description:
The league will only consist of Elite Ninja mono.

I’m also considering having it Ironmode.

Since I haven’t not played ENM Ironmode since the first week of it coming out.

It’s just the best way to play it, plus, more points.

All those pusher and erazer fags suck, just collecting colours, real men dodge greys.

Read full topic

item.title: Audiosurf
item.dc:creator: bob
item.description:
I tried the demo and it is fucking awesome. It’s so much better than Guitar Hero or Rock Band. Audio Surf is the only musical game I need to play. The only thing that did not make my demo experience complete was that I had a CD-R in the computer. It did not show the scoreboard because it was “Unknown Album, Unknown Artist”. I’ll put in commercial CD’s from now on so that I can get a score. I am definitely buying this game. It is a must have.

Read full topic

item.title: Audiosurf

item.description:

item.title: Audiosurf
item.dc:creator: bob
item.description:
For some reason, I like to play the demo first. It’s like a cliffhanger and I like cliffhangers. After I finish the demo and I’m like “I wonder, what’s next?” then I will buy the game. That’s just how I roll on Steam. If they have a demo, I play it first to see how it will work on my computer performance wise. Then if all is well in the performance department and I like the game, I buy the game on Steam.

Read full topic
